intro: Myriocladus churunensis, commonly known as the Churun spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Peru and Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often toxic species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap, which can be irritant to the skin. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
